Description: Attic red-figured pottery pyxis lid (reconstructed from numerous sherds and plaster); tongue frieze with dots in interstices on edge; on top of lid, two heads of Arimasps wearing Phrygian cap separate two pairs of griffin and panther, one pair facing, but fragmentarily preserved, the other with backs to each other; ivy leaf and circles as filling ornament; to centre, part of reserved band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Beazley attributed the piece to the Group of the Vienna lekanis. Alexandria 17078 is most likely a joining fragment.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1980)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (48, pl. 27, 10)
